translation: If there are any good men or good women who study and recite the Perfection of Wisdom, they are good men and good women.

source_sentence: 魔若魔天，若人若非人，終不能得其便，亦不得橫死。
translation: Whether it's a demon or a demon god, whether human or non-human, they can't get an advantage and won't be allowed to die horizontally.

source_sentence: 復次，拘翼！
translation: Furthermore, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 忉利天上諸天人，其有行佛道者，未得般若波羅蜜學誦者，是輩天人皆當往到善男子、善女人所。
translation: If there are gods and humans in the Trāyastriṃśa gods who practice the Buddha's path but haven't yet attained the perfection of prajñāpāramitā to study and recite it, these gods and humans will all go to good men and good women.

source_sentence: 其學持誦般若波羅蜜者，若行空閑屏隈之處，終不恐怖，無所畏懼。」
translation: Those who study and recite the prajñāpāramitā will never be frightened when they walk in a quiet retreat or secluded place, and they won't fear it.

source_sentence: 四天王白佛言：「我輩自共擁護是善男子、善女人學般若波羅蜜持者誦者。」
translation: The four celestial kings of heaven said to the Buddha, We will together embrace these good men and good women who study prajñā-pāramitā and recite it.

source_sentence: 梵摩三鉢天及諸梵天人俱白佛言：「我輩自共擁護是善男子、善女人學般若波羅蜜持誦者。」
translation: Brahma三鉢天及諸梵天人俱白佛,我輩自共擁護是善男子、善女人學般若波羅蜜持 Recitation者。

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「我自擁護是善男子、善女人學般若波羅蜜持誦者。」
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha, I myself will embrace these good men and good women who study prajñāpāramitā and recite it.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因復白佛言：「難及天中天！
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra then again said to the Buddha, It's difficult and heavenly among gods!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人有學般若波羅蜜者，便得現在法。
translation: If good men and good women have studied the perfection of wisdom, they'll attain the present teaching.

source_sentence: 其受般若波羅蜜者，天中天！
translation: Those who receive the perfection of prajñā-pāramitā are gods in heaven!

source_sentence: 為悉受六波羅蜜。」
translation: They'll all receive the six perfections.

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，拘翼！
translation: The Buddha said, So it is, Kauṇḍinya!

source_sentence: 其受般若波羅蜜者，為悉受六波羅蜜。
translation: Those who receive the perfection of prajñā-pāramitā are all recipients of the six perfections.

source_sentence: 復次，拘翼！
translation: Furthermore, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人學持諷誦般若波羅蜜者，拘翼！
translation: If good men and good women train to memorize and recite the prajñāpāramitā, Kauṇḍinya!

source_sentence: 且聽我說其人所得功德，上語亦善，中語亦善，下語亦善。」
translation: Listen as I explain the merits attained by that person, which are good in the higher words, good in the middle words, and good in the lower words.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因言：「受教。」
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said, Accept the teaching.

source_sentence: 佛語拘翼：「其欲於我法中有所嬈害亂者，其人稍稍起惡意欲來，未至中道而亡。
translation: The Buddha said to Kauśinagara, If someone wants to harm or disturb my teaching, they'll slightly become angry and want to come, but they won't reach the middle way and die.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人，用學般若波羅蜜持誦故，其人齎惡往來至，稍稍嬈害，
translation: Because these sons and daughters of a virtuous family study the Perfection of Wisdom (i.e., the Mahāprajñāpāramitā) in order to recite it, they may bring evil that will harm them even a little bit.

source_sentence: 亂意自止，便屈還，終不至是者。
translation: When the disturbed mind stops on its own, it bends back and never reaches this place.

source_sentence: 拘翼！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人所作，為悉自見得，用學持誦般若波羅蜜故。
translation: Good men and good women do so in order to see for themselves that they'll attain it because they study and recite the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 譬若有藥，拘翼，名為摩祇。
translation: It's like if there's a medicine that binds the wing, which is called magi.

source_sentence: 有蛇飢者行索食，所當噉食。
translation: A hungry snake walks around and begs for food, which it eats.

source_sentence: 道逢蟲豸，蛇欲噉之。
translation: On the way, he met a worm and was attacked by a snake that wanted to eat him.

source_sentence: 蟲行到摩祇藥所，蛇聞藥香即走還去。
translation: The worm traveled to the place where Mahe's medicine was prescribed, and when the snake heard the fragrance of the medicine, it ran back and forth.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 藥力所却。
translation: It's stopped by the power of the medicine.

source_sentence: 蛇毒即歇，藥力所厭。
translation: The poison of the snake immediately ceased, and he became disgusted by the power of the medicine.

source_sentence: 如是，拘翼！
translation: So it is, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 若善男子！
translation: Suppose good sons!

source_sentence: 善女人學持誦般若波羅蜜者，其有欲害，便自消亡，用般若波羅蜜威神力所却。」
translation: Good women who train in the recitation of the prajñāpāramitā and recite it will be killed if they have any desire to harm themselves, and they'll be driven away by the authoritative power of the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 佛言：「設有謀作者，所從來處，便於彼鬪，破壞不復成。
translation: The Buddha said, Suppose there's a plotter who goes from place to place and then fights over it, destroying it and no longer forming it.

source_sentence: 四天王皆擁護。
translation: The four heavenly kings all embraced it.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人若入般若波羅蜜中思惟者，自在所為，所語如甘露，
translation: Good men and good women, if they enter the perfection of wisdom and contemplate it, their unimpeded actions and words are like ambrosia.

source_sentence: 所語悉尊重，瞋恚不生，不自貢高。
translation: Their words are all respected, and their anger doesn't arise or become arrogant.

source_sentence: 四天王皆當擁護。
translation: The four heavenly kings will all embrace it.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人學持誦般若波羅蜜者，所語無有異，所言如甘露，所言不輕，
translation: Good men and good women who study and recite the Perfection of Wisdom are not different from each other in what they say. What they say is as sweet as ambrosia, and whatever they say is not despised.

source_sentence: 瞋恚不起，自貢高不生。
translation: Anger doesn't arise, and self-exaltedness doesn't arise.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 用學般若波羅蜜故。
translation: It's because it's used to train in the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 不愛貢高，不愛自用，不愛瞋恚。
translation: They don't like pride, don't like self-use, and don't like anger.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人心自生念：『若有鬪諍，常當遠離。』
translation: That good man or woman thinks to themselves, 'If there's a fight, they'll always be far removed.'

source_sentence: 面自羞慚，念：『是曹之惡而不可近。』
translation: Being ashamed of himself, he thought, 'This is the evil of Cao and can't be approached.'

source_sentence: 自念：『我索佛道，不可隨瞋恚語，疾使我逮好心。』
translation: He thought to himself, 'I ask for the Buddha's path, so don't follow angry words that quickly make me acquire good intentions.'

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人所作，為悉自見現在功德，其學持誦般若波羅蜜者亦爾。」
translation: This is what good men and good women do for the sake of fully seeing their present merits, and so are those who study and recite the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「難當天中天！
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha, Nai, god of gods!

source_sentence: 為般若波羅蜜者，乃過諸惡上去，自在所作，無有與等者。」
translation: For the sake of the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, he goes beyond all evil and creates it freely, with no equal.

source_sentence: 佛語釋提桓因：「復次，拘翼！
translation: The Buddha said to Śakra Devānām-Indra, Furthermore, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人學持誦般若波羅蜜者，或過劇難之中終不恐，正使入軍不被兵。」
translation: Good men and good women who train in the recitation of the prajñāpāramitā will never fear even if they go through a great difficulty, just so they won't be attacked by soldiers when they enter an army.

source_sentence: 佛言：「我所語，無有異。
translation: The Buddha said, There's no difference between what I say.

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人當是時念誦般若波羅蜜，正使於中當死，若冤家在中欲共害之，
translation: If good men and good women recite the prajñāpāramitā at that time, they'll surely die there, and if their enemies are in it and want to harm them together,

source_sentence: 如佛所語無有異，是善男子、善女人終不於中橫死。
translation: As the Buddha said, there's no difference between what good men and good women will never die horizontally in it.

source_sentence: 正使在中，若有射者，若有兵向者，終不中其身。
translation: If there's a messenger in it, if there's a shooter or an army that's headed for him, he won't touch his body.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 是般若波羅蜜者，極大呪，持尊之呪。
translation: This is the great dhāraṇī of prajñā-pāramitā, which is a great dhāraṇī that holds the honored dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 學是呪者，善男子、善女人不自念惡，亦不念他人惡，都不念惡，為人中之雄，
translation: Good men and good women who study this dhāraṇī won’t think of evil for themselves, nor will they think of the evil of others. They won’t think of evil, and they’ll be the heroes among men.

source_sentence: 自致作佛，當護一切人。
translation: Being a buddha on your own will protect all people.

source_sentence: 學是呪者，疾成得佛。
translation: Those who study this dhāraṇī will quickly become buddhas.

source_sentence: 復次，拘翼，若書般若波羅蜜學持誦經者，若人若非人不能害之，除宿命之罪不可請避。
translation: Furthermore, Kauṇḍinya, if someone writes the Prajñāpāramitā and trains to recite it, they won't be harmed by people or non-people, and they won't be asked to avoid it except for the sin of past lives.

source_sentence: 若佛初得道處，若有人從在方面來入其中，若鬼神禽獸欲來嬈者，終不能傷害。
translation: If someone comes into the place where the Buddha first attained enlightenment and enters it from a direction, or if ghosts, spirits, animals, and animals want to disturb them, they can't harm them.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 用過去當來今現在佛悉從是處自致成佛。
translation: Using past, future, and present buddhas in the present, they all become buddhas from this place for themselves.

source_sentence: 以是故，不恐不怖無所畏懼。
translation: Because of this, they aren't afraid or frightened, and there's nothing to fear.

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜者亦復如是，在所止處，一切皆為作禮恭敬護視之。」
translation: The prajñāpāramitā is likewise, and wherever it's stopped, everything pays homage to it, respects it, and guards it.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「若有，天中天！
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha, Yes, god of gods!

source_sentence: 書般若波羅蜜、持經卷自歸作禮承事者，名華、好香擣香雜香澤香燒香、繒綵華蓋幢幡以是供養，
translation: Those who write the prajñāpāramitā and preserve the sūtras in scrolls return with reverence to those who serve them, making offerings of flowers, good fragrances, odors, mixed fragrances, scents, aromatic powders, burning incense, silk fabrics, flower garlands, canopies, banners, banners, and streamers.

source_sentence: 若有持怛薩阿竭阿羅訶三耶三佛舍利起塔，自歸作禮承事，好華、名香擣香雜香澤香燒香、繒綵華蓋幢幡持用供養。」
translation: Suppose someone holds a stūpa of the relics of the tathāgata, arhat, samaya, and samyak-saṃbuddha Buddha's relics, pays homage to it on their own, makes offerings with good flowers, famous incense, fragrant odors, mixed fragrant scents, burning incense, silk fabrics, canopies, banner

source_sentence: 佛問拘翼：「如是，其福何所為多者？
translation: The Buddha asked Kauśinagara, So, what's the great deal of merit in that?

source_sentence: 隨所樂報。
translation: It's the result of following what's pleasing.

source_sentence: 云何，拘翼！
translation: What do you think, Kauṇḍinya?

source_sentence: 怛薩阿竭阿羅訶三耶三菩自致薩芸若，成佛身出見，從何法中學，得阿耨多羅三耶三菩阿惟三佛？」
translation: Where did he attain unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment?

source_sentence: 釋提桓因報言：「怛薩阿竭從般若波羅蜜學，得阿耨多羅三耶三菩，自致成阿惟三佛。」
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra replied, Tathāgata trains from the perfection of wisdom and attains unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment by himself to become an abhisaṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 佛語釋提桓因：「不用身舍利故，為從薩芸若得佛。
translation: The Buddha said to Śakra Devānām-Indra, It's because he didn't use the body and relics that he wanted to attain Buddhahood from the saṃyuktâgama.

source_sentence: 怛薩阿竭者，為從般若波羅蜜出。
translation: A tathāgata is someone who emerges from the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 如是，拘翼！
translation: So it is, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 薩芸若身者，為從般若波羅蜜出。
translation: The body of sarvajña comes from the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 怛薩阿竭阿羅訶三耶三菩，為從薩芸若生。
translation: The tathāgata, the arhat, the samaya, and the three bodhisattvas are born from the saṃyuktâgama.

source_sentence: 我得作佛身，我般泥洹已後，舍利亦得供養。
translation: I'll be able to make a buddha-body, and after my parinirvāṇa, the relics will also be an offering.

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人書般若波羅蜜，學持誦行，自歸作禮承事，以好華、名香擣香雜香澤香燒香、繒綵華蓋幢幡持用供養，
translation: Suppose there are good men and good women who write the Perfection of Wisdom, study it, memorize it, recite it, revere it, serve it, and make offerings with beautiful flowers, famous incense, fragrant odors, aromatic powders, burning incense, silk-mbroidered flower garlands, canopies, banners, pennants, banners

source_sentence: 即為供養薩芸若慧已。
translation: That's after making offerings to the wisdom of the saṃyuktâgama.

source_sentence: 復次，拘翼！
translation: Furthermore, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 其有書般若波羅蜜者，持經卷雖不讀，但供養作禮，是善男子、善女人從其中得功德無比。
translation: If there's someone who writes the perfection of wisdom and holds a sūtra scroll but doesn't read it, but makes offerings and venerates it, that good man or woman will attain unsurpassed merit from them.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 為供養薩芸若慧故。」
translation: It's for the sake of making offerings to the wisdom of sarvajña.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「如是，天中天！
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha, So it is, god of gods!

source_sentence: 閻浮利人不供養事般若波羅蜜者，是輩人不知般若波羅蜜為尊，當得福無比。」
translation: If people in Jambudvīpa don't offer support for the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, these people won't know that the perfection of prajñāpāramitā is the honored one, and they'll attain unsurpassed merit.

source_sentence: 佛語釋提桓因：「云何，拘翼！
translation: The Buddha said to Śakra Devānām-Indra, What's the point, Kauṣṭhila?

source_sentence: 閻浮利人中有幾所信佛、信法、信比丘僧者？」
translation: How many people in Jambudvīpa believe in the Buddha, believe in the Dharma, and believe in monks and nuns?

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「閻浮利人少，所信佛、信法、信比丘僧者，少少耳。
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra then said to the Buddha, There are few people in Jambudvīpa who believe in the Buddha, the Dharma, or the monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 及行須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢、辟支佛，少少耳。
translation: And the practice of stream-winner, once-returner, non-returner, arhat, and pratyekabuddha are few in number.

source_sentence: 能至行佛道者，亦復少少耳。」
translation: Those who can reach the stage of practicing the Buddha Way are also few and few.

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，拘翼！
translation: The Buddha said, So it is, Kauṇḍinya!

source_sentence: 至有索佛道行者，亦復少少耳。
translation: Even if there are those who ask for the Buddha's path of practice, they're also few and few.

source_sentence: 求佛者不可計阿僧祇人，欲作菩薩行，然後從其中出者，若一若兩在阿惟越致地立。
translation: Those who seek Buddhahood can't be counted as an incalculable number of people who want to perform the bodhisattva's practice and then emerge from it, whether one or two of them are standing on the stage of abhidharma.

source_sentence: 以是故，拘翼！
translation: Because of this, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人行求佛道者，學持誦般若波羅蜜經，當為作禮承事恭敬。
translation: If good men and good women practice the Buddha's path and seek to study and recite the Prajñāpāramitā sūtra, they should pay homage, serve, and venerate it.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

translation: That heretic then stayed at a distant place, circled the gods in heaven once more, and departed on that path.

source_sentence: 舍利弗心念：「云何異道人從彼間中道而去？」
translation: Śāriputra thought to himself, How did a heretic leave the middle way from that place?

source_sentence: 佛知舍利弗心所念，即言：「是異道人無有好意來。

source_sentence: 釋提桓因念般若波羅蜜，以故中道還去。」
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra was mindful of the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, so he returned and departed in the middle way.

source_sentence: 弊魔作是念：「怛薩阿竭阿羅訶三耶三佛與四輩弟子共坐，欲天、梵天諸天子悉復在中無有異人，
translation: The Evil One thought: “The Tathāgatas, the arhats, the samyak-saṃbuddhas, and the fourfold assembly of disciples are seated together.

source_sentence: 弊魔化乘一轅之車，駕四馬，稍稍欲前到佛所。
translation: The wicked Māra then rode the four horses in a cart drawn by a single stroke of the wheel and proceeded to where the Buddha was.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因念：「弊魔乘四馬之車，欲來到佛所。
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra thought to himself, “That evil Māra is riding in a chariot drawn by four horses and wishes to visit the Buddha.

source_sentence: 非國王[卄\/汧]沙四馬之車，亦不類國王波斯匿四馬之車，亦非類釋種墮舍利種四馬之車。
translation: It's not like the four-horse chariot of the king of the country [un \/ ] sand, nor is it like the four-horse chariot of the king of the country Prasenajit, nor is it like the four-horse chariot of the Śākyamuni and Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 不類，是弊魔所作。
translation: It's not the same, but it's created by a bad demon.

source_sentence: 常念索佛便，欲亂世間人。
translation: He always thought of seeking the Buddha's help, wanting to disturb people in the world.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因常願欲念誦讀般若波羅蜜。」
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra always wishes to recite and read the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 即時心念般若波羅蜜且欲究竟，弊魔即復道還去。
translation: Immediately, he's mindful of the perfection of prajñāpāramitā and wants to finish it, and that bad demon then returns again.

source_sentence: 忉利天上人持所化華，飛在空中，用散佛上。
translation: The gods in Trāyastriṃśa gods carried the flower they transformed and flew up into the sky to scatter it on top of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 皆言：「使般若波羅蜜得久在閻浮利，令人悉得聞見。」
translation: They all said, Enable the perfection of wisdom to stay in Jambudvīpa for a long time so that they can hear and see it.

source_sentence: 便復持天上若干種華已，散佛上。
translation: He then again held several kinds of flowers from heaven and scattered them on top of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 皆言：「其有行般若波羅蜜者、守般若波羅蜜者，亦不為魔及魔天所得便。」
translation: They all said, Those who practice the perfection of prajñāpāramitā and guard the perfection of prajñāpāramitā won't be given an opportunity by Māra or the Māra gods.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「其聞般若波羅蜜者，是輩人其福功德不少，何況學誦持者，
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha, “Those who hear the Perfection of Wisdom will have great merit and virtue, so why wouldn’t those who study and recite it?

source_sentence: 諷誦學已復行教人，是人前世已為見佛從聞般若波羅蜜。
translation: After reciting it and training it, he then taught it again to someone who had seen the Buddha and heard the prajñāpāramitā from him in a previous life.

source_sentence: 何況學持誦已行如中事者，即為供養怛薩阿竭已。
translation: How could it be that someone who trains, recites, and conducts themselves in such a way would make offerings to the tathāgata after they've done so?

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 欲得薩芸若者，當從般若波羅蜜。
translation: Those who want to attain sarvajña should follow the perfection of prajñā.

source_sentence: 譬如欲得極天寶者，天中天！
translation: It's like someone who wants to attain the ultimate heavenly treasure, god of gods!

source_sentence: 當從大海。
translation: They'll follow the great ocean.

source_sentence: 欲得薩芸若珍寶者，天中天！
translation: Those who want to attain the treasures of the saṃyuktâgama, god of gods!

source_sentence: 怛薩阿竭阿羅訶三耶三佛，當從般若波羅蜜索之。」
translation: The tathāgata, the arhat, the samaya, and the three buddhas will ask for it from the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，如是！
translation: The Buddha said, So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 拘翼！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 怛薩阿竭阿羅訶三耶三佛為從薩芸若出。」
translation: The Tathāgata, the arhat, the samaya, and the three buddhas come out of the saṃyuktâgama.

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「無有說檀波羅蜜者，亦不尸波羅蜜，亦不羼波羅蜜，亦不惟逮波羅蜜，
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha: There is no discourse on the perfection of giving that does not include the perfection of morality, the perfection of abstention, and the perfection of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 亦不禪波羅蜜，都無說是字者，但共說般若波羅蜜。
translation: Nor does he teach the perfection of meditation, but he teaches the perfection of prajñā together.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 天中天！」
translation: God of gods!

source_sentence: 佛語阿難：「般若波羅蜜，五波羅蜜中最尊。
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, The perfection of wisdom is the most honored of the five perfections.

source_sentence: 云何，阿難！
translation: What is it, Ānanda?

source_sentence: 不作薩芸若布施，能為檀波羅蜜不？
translation: If you don't make a donation of the saṃyuktâgama, can you give it for the perfection of giving?

source_sentence: 不作薩芸若淨戒、忍辱、精進、一心、智慧，能為尸、羼、惟逮、禪波羅蜜不？」
translation: If you don't practice the pure precepts of sarvajña, forbearance, effort, concentration, and wisdom, will you be able to attain the perfections of śīla, anger, pervasiveness, and meditation?

source_sentence: 阿難言：「如是，如是！
translation: Ānanda said, So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 天中天！
translation: God of gods!

source_sentence: 無波羅蜜者為布施，薩芸若者是檀波羅蜜。
translation: The absence of the perfection is generosity, and sarvajña is the perfection of giving.

source_sentence: 無波羅蜜為戒、忍辱、精進、一心、智慧，薩芸若者是般若波羅蜜。」
translation: The absence of the perfection is morality, forbearance, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom, and sarvajña is the perfection of prajñā.

source_sentence: 佛語阿難：「用是故，般若波羅蜜，五波羅蜜中為最尊。
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, For this reason, the prajñāpāramitā is the most honored of the five perfections.

source_sentence: 譬如掘地，以種散其中，同時俱出生。
translation: It's like digging into the ground and spreading it with seeds, which are produced together at the same time.

source_sentence: 如是，阿難！
translation: So it is, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜者為生，五波羅蜜薩芸若者從般若波羅蜜成。
translation: The prajñāpāramitā is for birth, and the five perfections are accomplished from the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 以是故，阿難！
translation: Because of this, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜於五波羅蜜為極大尊、自在所教。」
translation: The perfection of prajñāpāramitā is taught by the five perfections as extremely great honored and unimpeded.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「怛薩阿竭阿羅訶三耶三佛說：『善男子、善女人從般若波羅蜜教學持誦者，
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 說其功德未能竟。』」
translation: I can't finish explaining their merits.'

source_sentence: 佛語拘翼：「我不說諷起者功德未竟，說善男子、善女人書般若波羅蜜者，
translation: The Buddha said to Kauṇḍinya, I won't explain the merits of those who recite it before their completion, but will explain that good men and good women write prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 持經卷自歸作禮承事，供養名華好香、擣香雜香澤香燒香、繒綵華蓋幢幡，
translation: He took the sūtras and fascicles, bowed his head in homage, and honored them with offerings of fragrant flowers, garlands, mixed scents, aromatic powders, burning incense, silhouetted flower canopies, curtains, banners, pennants, and streamers.

source_sentence: 我說是供養功德耳。」
translation: I say this is the merit of making offerings.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛：「我自擁護視是善男子、善女人書般若波羅蜜，持經卷自歸供養承事名華好香、擣香雜香澤香燒香、繒綵華蓋幢幡者。」
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha, I myself embraced and guarded these good men and good women who wrote prajñāpāramitā, held sūtras in scrolls, made offerings on their behalf, and served them with names like lotus blossoms, garlands, mixed fragrances, burning incense, silk flowers, canopies,

source_sentence: 佛語拘翼：「善男子、善女人誦般若波羅蜜時，若干百千天往到其所聽聞其法。
translation: The Buddha said to Kauṣṭhila, Good men and good women, when they recite the prajñāpāramitā, hundreds of thousands of gods go there to hear its teaching.

source_sentence: 若有於法不解欲問法師，適作是念。
translation: If someone doesn't understand the teaching and wants to ask the teacher of the Dharma, they should think this.

source_sentence: 用茲法故，應時各解。
translation: Because of the use of these teachings, they should be understood at the right time.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人便得今現在法聽。
translation: Good men and good women will then be able to listen to the present teaching.

source_sentence: 「復次，拘翼！
translation: Furthermore, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人於四輩弟子中說般若波羅蜜，其心都無所難，若形試者終不畏。
translation: Good men and good women who teach the perfection of prajñā among the four groups of disciples have no difficulty in their minds, and they never fear it if they are tested by form.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 為般若波羅蜜所擁護，其所形試者便即而去。」
translation: They're protected by the perfection of wisdom, and those who test their forms will then go away.

source_sentence: 佛言：「我了不見為般若波羅蜜者，何況欲形試般若波羅蜜，即是不能得見，
translation: The Buddha said, I don't see anyone who understands the perfection of wisdom, so why wouldn't I want to test the perfection of wisdom in form, which means I can't see it?

source_sentence: 為般若波羅蜜之所厭服。
translation: They're disillusioned with the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人無有敢輕易者，心亦無所畏恐。
translation: Good men and good women don't dare to despise them, and their minds have no fear or fear.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人，為悉見今現在所作功德法。
translation: Good men and good women, this is the way to fully see the merits of what's done in the present.

source_sentence: 「復次，拘翼！
translation: Furthermore, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，敬愛父母、沙門、道人、知識、兄弟、宗親、中外，
translation: Good men and good women love their parents, renunciants, religious practitioners, teachers, friends, brothers, sisters, relatives, and people of the middle and lower classes.

source_sentence: 或時其欲說惡事者，持中正法為解說之。
translation: Sometimes someone who wants to teach bad things will explain the right teaching in the midst of maintaining it for their understanding.

source_sentence: 是者，拘翼！
translation: Yes, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，便得今現在所作功德法。
translation: Good men and good women, they'll then attain the merits of what they've done in the present.

source_sentence: 「復次，拘翼！
translation: Furthermore, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人書般若波羅蜜持經卷書，四天王上諸天人索佛道者，當到彼所問訊聽受般若波羅蜜，
translation: Good men and good women write the Prajñāpāramitā-sūtra in scrolls, and those in the heavens above the four heavenly kings who seek the Buddha's path will go there to greet them and hear and accept the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 作禮遶竟便去。
translation: After paying homage, he left.

source_sentence: 忉利天上諸天人索佛道者，當到彼所問訊聽受般若波羅蜜，作禮遶竟便去。
translation: Those in Trāyastriṃśa gods and goddesses who seek the Buddha's path will go there to greet them, hear them receive the prajñāpāramitā, venerate them, and then leave.

source_sentence: 鹽天上諸天人索佛道者，當到彼所問訊聽受般若波羅蜜，作禮遶竟便去。
translation: Those gods and humans in the salt heaven who ask for the Buddha's path will go there, exchange greetings, listen to the acceptance of the prajñāpāramitā, make obeisance, and leave.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人心當知。
translation: You should know that this is the mind of good men and good women.

source_sentence: 無央數阿僧祇佛剎，諸天人、龍、閱叉、揵陀羅、阿須倫、迦樓羅、甄陀、摩睺休、人非人，
translation: In countless, incalculable buddha-lands, gods, humans, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans.

source_sentence: 當來到是間問訊聽受般若波羅蜜，作禮遶竟各自便去。
translation: When they come here, they'll exchange greetings and listen to the acceptance of the prajñāpāramitā, make obeisance, and then leave.

source_sentence: 是即為施。
translation: This is called giving.

source_sentence: 兜術天上諸天人索佛道者，當到彼所問訊聽受般若波羅蜜，作禮遶竟便去。
translation: Those in Tuṣita Heaven and the gods and humans in heaven who seek the Buddha's path will go there to greet them, hear them receive the prajñāpāramitā, venerate them, and then leave.

source_sentence: 尼摩羅提天上諸天人索佛道者，當到彼間問訊聽受般若波羅蜜，作禮遶竟便去。
translation: Those gods and humans in Nirmāṇarati Heaven who seek the Buddha's path will go there to greet and listen to receive the prajñāpāramitā, make obeisance, and then leave.

source_sentence: 波羅尼蜜和耶拔致天上諸天人索佛道者，當到彼所問訊聽受般若波羅蜜，
translation: Those in the heavens above Vārāṇasī who seek the Buddha's path will go there to greet and listen to the perfection of wisdom,

source_sentence: 作禮遶竟便去。
translation: After paying homage, he left.

source_sentence: 梵迦夷天、梵富樓天、梵波產天、摩訶梵天、[病-丙+盍]天、波利陀天、[病-丙+盍]波摩那天、阿陂亘羞天、波利陀首訶天、阿波摩首天、首訶迦天、惟番羅天、阿比天、阿陀首天、首陀施天、阿迦膩吒天等諸天人，
translation: The Brahmakāyika gods, the Brahmaputra gods, the Brahmapurocana gods, the Mahābrahmā gods, the [sickness-c+] gods, the Pārijātaka gods, the [sickness-c+] pārijātaka gods, the abhidharma gods, the Parīttaśubha gods

source_sentence: 皆當到彼所問訊聽受般若波羅蜜，作禮遶竟便各自去。
translation: They will all go to that place to exchange greetings and listen to the acceptance of the prajñāpāramitā, make obeisance, and then leave.

source_sentence: 乃至阿迦膩吒天常悉來下。
translation: Up to the Akaniṣṭha gods always come down.

source_sentence: 何況，拘翼！
translation: How much more so, Kauṇḍinya!

source_sentence: 三千大千國土諸欲天人、諸色天人，悉皆當來問訊聽受般若波羅蜜，作禮遶竟各自還去。
translation: The gods of the 3,000 great one-thousand lands, gods of desire and gods of form, will all come to greet and listen to receive the prajñāpāramitā, make obeisance, and return home after paying homage.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人在所止處，常當完堅無有嬈者，除其宿命不請，餘不能動。
translation: Good men and good women, wherever they are staying, will always be firm and without disturbance, except for those who won't be invited by their past lives and won't move.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人便得今現在功德法，諸天來時當可知。」
translation: Good men and good women will then attain the presently meritorious Dharma, which will be known when the gods come.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因：「云何，天中天！
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said, What is it, god of gods!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人，當何從知諸天來時，聽受承事供養作禮？」
translation: How will these good men and good women know the time when the gods come to listen, serve, make offerings, and pay homage to them?

source_sentence: 佛言：「善男子、善女人若見光明，知諸天若龍、閱叉、揵陀羅來聽受般若波羅蜜承事作禮，
translation: The Buddha said, Good sons and good women, if they see the light, they'll know that gods, dragons, yakṣas, and gandharvas are coming to hear, receive, serve, venerate, and pay homage to the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 其心歡喜踊躍知已為來。
translation: Their hearts rejoice and jump for joy, knowing that they've come.

source_sentence: 「復次，拘翼！
translation: Furthermore, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人曾所不聞香、若聞香，當知鬼神來已。
translation: Good men and good women who haven't heard a fragrance or smelled a fragrance should know that the spirits have come.

source_sentence: 「復次，拘翼！
translation: Furthermore, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人當淨身體。
translation: Good men and good women should purify their bodies.

source_sentence: 用淨潔故，鬼神皆大歡喜，數往到彼所。
translation: Because it's pure and clean, the ghosts and spirits all rejoice greatly and frequently go there.

source_sentence: 其人踊躍，如小天去大天來到，以是譬之，其威神甚尊，光明巍巍。
translation: That person dances and jumps, just like the small gods that depart from the large gods and come to them. This is an analogy for their great majesty, which is so majestic and lofty with its radiance.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人常歡喜淨潔住，其病終不著身，所止常得安隱，未曾有惡夢。
translation: That good man or woman always rejoices and abides purely, doesn't cling to her body when she's sick, always attains peace where she stays, and never has a bad dream.

source_sentence: 夢中不見餘，但見佛；
translation: They do not see anything else in their dreams but the Buddha.

source_sentence: 但見塔；
translation: They simply saw the stupas.

source_sentence: 但聞般若波羅蜜；
translation: They simply hear the transcendent wisdom of liberation.

source_sentence: 但見佛所坐樹；
translation: They simply saw the tree where the Buddha was seated.

source_sentence: 但見法輪轉；
translation: They simply see the wheel of the Teaching.

source_sentence: 但見且欲成佛時；
translation: They only see it when they want to attain buddhahood.

source_sentence: 但見諸佛成得佛已轉法輪；
translation: They simply see the buddhas becoming buddhas and turning the wheel of teaching after attaining buddhahood.

source_sentence: 但見若干菩薩；
translation: They simply see a certain number of bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 但見說六波羅蜜種種為解慧；
translation: They simply see the various explanations of the six transcendent ways as wisdom of understanding.

source_sentence: 但見當作佛者；
translation: They only see those who will become buddhas.

source_sentence: 但見餘佛剎；
translation: They only see other buddha-lands.

source_sentence: 但聞佛尊法；
translation: They merely hear the Buddha’s teaching.

source_sentence: 但見某方某剎怛薩阿竭阿羅訶三耶三佛，若干百千弟子、若干億弟子，
translation: They simply see a certain buddha in a certain place, a certain buddha-samyak-saṃbuddha, with hundreds of thousands of disciples and millions of disciples.

source_sentence: 佛在其中而說法。
translation: The Buddha teaches the Dharma while he's there.

source_sentence: 是者，拘翼！
translation: Yes, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，於夢中所見已便安隱，覺即身為輕，不復思食，身如食軟美而飽。
translation: Good men and good women, having seen what they saw in a dream, then become peaceful, perceive that their bodies are light, don't think about food again, and their bodies are like food that's soft and delicious and full.

translation: Suppose a monk attains meditation and, having awakened from meditation, his mind is so soft and good-natured that he doesn't think much about food that's inherently soft and delicious.

translation: Suppose it's like a king who lives in dependence and is respected by people.

translation: Kauṣṭhila-āgaśāriputra is born from the saṃyuktâgama, and he's able to make offerings to this wisdom of the god Sākyamuni in heaven.

source_sentence: 怛薩阿竭阿羅訶三耶三佛為從般若波羅蜜出，當作是知。
translation: This is how you should know that the tathāgatas, arhats, and sages come out of the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 兩分之中，我取般若波羅蜜。
translation: In both parts, I take the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 其受般若波羅蜜持者，譬如無價摩尼珠。
translation: Those who receive the precepts of prajñā-pāramitā are like priceless maṇi jewels.

source_sentence: 天中天！

translation: There's this treasure, and there's no equal of it.

translation: Where they're attached, the spirits won't get an advantage over them and won't be harmed by the spirits.

translation: If it is hot in the middle, hold this maṇi-pearl over your body and remove the heat by putting it there.

source_sentence: 若中風者，持是摩尼珠著身上，其風即為除；
translation: If there is a wind in the middle, take this maṇi-pearl and put it on your body. The wind will remove it.

source_sentence: 若中寒者，持是摩尼珠著身上，其寒不復增，即得除去；
translation: If it is cold in the midst of winter, take this maṇi-pearl and put it on your body. When the cold doesn’t grow any more, you will be able to get rid of it.

source_sentence: 若夜時持摩尼珠著冥中，即為悉明；
translation: If he were to take the maṇi-pearl at night and put it in the darkness, he would become perfectly clear.

source_sentence: 若熱時持摩尼珠在所著處，即為大涼；
translation: When it is hot, he holds the maṇi-pearl in his hand and places it wherever he puts it.

source_sentence: 若寒時持摩尼珠在所著處，即為大溫；
translation: When it is cold, one holds the maṇi jewel in the place where one puts it. This is great warmth.

source_sentence: 在所置處，諸毒即為不行。
translation: Where it's placed, the poisons won't work.

source_sentence: 若男子女人，無大無小，若蛇蟒所齧，持是摩尼珠著之，毒即自去。
translation: If a man or woman, neither large nor small, is caught by a snake or a conch, he or she holds this maṇi bead and puts it on him or her, and the poison goes away on its own.

source_sentence: 是摩尼珠，天中天！
translation: This is the maṇi-pearl, god of gods!

source_sentence: 之為極尊。
translation: He's the ultimate honored one.

translation: If someone has a pain in their eyes when they're sick, and if they attain darkness in their eyes, hold this maṇi bead close to their eyes with it, and the pain will be healed.

source_sentence: 如是，天中天！

source_sentence: 摩尼珠之德甚大巍巍。
translation: The merit of the maṇi-pearl is so great and lofty.

source_sentence: 持若干種繒鄭重裹摩尼珠著其水中，水即隨色；
translation: He carried various kinds of precious stones, heavily wrapped them in water and placed the jewels in their water. The water was as colorful as they were.

source_sentence: 若水濁者，即時為清。
